item.title: Expecto transphobum!
item.description: In the Harry Potter books, when a witch or wizard wants to cast a Patronus Charm, they have to fixate on a particularly happy memory.1 If successful, they can produce a corporeal Patronus – an animal formed of dazzling, blinding light – that can drive away Dementors. What about us mere muggles? Well, we do things a little differently. Often, when we need a defensive boost, we tend to fixate on bad memories – instances where we were wronged or victimized.
